attributes.action: Update the rehoming strategy for dogs and cats in UK laboratories
attributes.additional_details: Minimal applications of licences by laboratories offer a rehoming strategy for dogs and cats after experimentation or if a surplus to need. It has been shown that laboratory animals can be rehomed successfully after rehabilitation in organisations such as the RSCPA. The LASA document shows a possible strategy which has not been addressed and should be put into action by the Government. https://www.lasa.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2018/05/LASA-Guidance-on-the-Rehoming-of-Laboratory-Dogs.pdf
attributes.background: All Laboratories involving dogs/cats should be required to have a rehoming strategy as a condition of being issued a licence and for the Government to fund a care/home system for laboratory animals. They should make public their adoption policies for rehoming and publish rehoming figures annually.
